intro: Centaurea limburgensis, commonly known as the Limburg centaury, is a flowering plant native to the lowland regions of the Netherlands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are usually a mix of blue and purple, with a yellow center, and bloom from June to August. Centaurea limburgensis is often found in meadows and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
